Before applying to any university to read pharmacy, you must know the following.

Every young and growing child aspiring to discover and contribute positively to healthy living would choose pharmacy as a career professional in his university ambition. The vital key for young school leavers looking forward to studying pharmacy as a profession is paying attention to the origin of pharmacy, the root of drugs that cure and prevent certain diseases in the universe.

In the context given below, the scope of studying pharmacy is highlighted.

What is Pharmacy

Pharmacy is the clinical health science that deals with medical science with chemistry and it is charged with the discovery, production, disposal, safe and effective use, and control of medications and drugs.

Why Do We Study Pharmacy?

Pharmacy requires the essential handling of drugs, their mechanism of action, toxicity, interactions, side effects. At the same time, it is necessary to understand the knowledge of treatment and understanding of the pathological processes. For some professionals, such as of clinical pharmacists, it also necessary to know about the acquisition and evaluation of physical/laboratory data.

Scope Of Studying Pharmacy

The scope of practicing pharmacy includes the roles in dispensing of medical drugs, and it also includes more modern services related to health care, including clinical services, reviewing medications for safety and efficiency, and providing drug information or data. They are licensed healthcare professional who specializes in providing information about different medication and methods of treatment, they are also the experts on drugs therapy and are the primary health professionals who direct the use of medication for the benefit of the patients.

Choosing Pharmacy as a Career

Pharmacy can generally be divided into three primary disciplines these are:

  • Pharmaceutics
  • Pharmacy Practice
  • Medical Chemistry and Pharmacognosy

The difference between these disciplines and other sciences, such as biochemistry, is not always clear-cut. Mostly, collaborative teams from various disciplines (pharmacists and other scientists) join together toward the introduction of new therapeutics and methods in providing solutions to their patients.

Pharmacology is sometimes regarded as the 4th discipline of pharmacy. Although it is essential to the study of pharmacy. Both disciplines are distinct. Those who determined to study both pharmacies (patient-oriented) and pharmacology (a biomedical science requiring the scientific method) undergo separate training and degrees unique to either discipline.

Pharmacoinformatics is considered to be another new discipline, for systematic drug discovery and development with efficiency and safety.

Pharmacogenomics is the study of genetic-linked variants that affect allergies, patient clinical responses, and metabolism of drugs

Professional (Pharmacist)

A professional who practices pharmacy is called a pharmacist.

Pharmacists are healthcare professionals with specialized knowledge who perform various roles to ensure optimal health outcomes of the patients through the quality use of medicines. Pharmacists know about the form of action on a particular drug and its metabolism, and physiological effects on the human body in great detail, they deal in the optimization of drug treatment for an individual or patients. They may operate on small-business proprietors, owning the pharmacy in which they practice.

The high purchase of medications and drug-related technology and the potential impact of medications and pharmacy services on patient-care outcomes and patient safety require hospital pharmacies to perform at the highest level possible. Most hospital pharmacies have determined to outsource high-risk preparations and some other compounding functions to companies who specialize in compounding.

They are responsible for taking care of the patients and also providing services that optimize the use of medication and promote wellness, health, and disease prevention.

What Subjects Are Needed To Study Pharmacy?

The following subject combination is essential to study pharmacy in a higher institution

  • Use of English
  • Mathematics
  • Chemistry
  • Physic

O-Level Requirement To Read Pharmacy

  • Mathematic-credit
  • English language-credit
  • Chemistry-credit
  • Physic-credit
  • Biology-credit
  • Social study-credit
  • Computer-credit
  • CRK credit
  • Agric/Government-credit

Jamb Cut-Off Marks for Pharmacy

The jamb cut-off mark to merit admission into higher institutions is 270 and above. Sometimes, this varies depending on the University departmental cut off marks.

How Many Years Can Someone Study Pharmacy?

Pharmacy is 5 years.

Likely, many schools allow students to spend 5 years studying Pharmacy in the university.
